item.title: CVE-2022-28840|2024-08-03T06:03:53.156Z -- adobe -- bridge
item.description: Adobe Bridge version 12.0.1 (and earlier versions) is affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

Exploitation of this issue requires low-privilege access to AEM.

item.title: CVE-2022-28820|2024-08-03T06:03:53.148Z -- adobe -- experience%20manager
item.description: ACS Commons version 5.1.x (and earlier) suffers from a Reflected Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in /apps/acs-commons/content/page-compare.html endpoint via the a and b GET parameters. User input submitted via these parameters is not validated or sanitised. An attacker must provide a link to someone with access to AEM Author, and could potentially exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious JavaScript content into vulnerable form fields and execute it within the context of the victim's browser. item.title: CVE-2022-23202|2024-08-03T03:36:20.175Z -- adobe -- creative%20cloud%20%28desktop%20component%29
item.description: Adobe Creative Cloud Desktop version 2.7.0.13 (and earlier) is affected by an Uncontrolled Search Path Element vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must download a malicious DLL file. The attacker has to deliver the DLL on the same folder as the installer which makes it as a high complexity attack vector.

item.description: Adobe Experience Manager versions 6.5.13.0 (and earlier) is affected by a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability. Exploitation of this issue requires low-privilege access to AEM.

item.title: CVE-2024-34113|2024-06-13T11:27:15.139Z -- adobe -- coldfusion
item.description: ColdFusion versions 2023u7, 2021u13 and earlier are affected by a Weak Cryptography for Passwords vulnerability that could result in a security feature bypass. This vulnerability arises due to the use of insufficiently strong cryptographic algorithms or flawed implementation that compromises the confidentiality of password data. An attacker could exploit this weakness to decrypt or guess passwords, potentially gaining unauthorized access to protected resources. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

item.title: CVE-2024-34129|2024-06-13T11:28:32.459Z -- adobe -- acrobat%20mobile%20sign%20android
item.description: Acrobat Mobile Sign Android versions 24.4.2.33155 and earlier are affected by an Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability that could result in a security feature bypass. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to access files and directories that are outside the restricted directory and also to overwrite arbitrary files. Exploitation of this issue does not requires user interaction and attack complexity is high.

item.title: CVE-2024-20753|2024-06-13T11:22:34.722Z -- adobe -- photoshop%20desktop

Exploitation of this issue typically requires user interaction, such as convincing a victim to click on a specially crafted link or to submit a form that triggers the malicious script.
